title: Understanding Entropy in Phase Changes
text: Consider what happens to the order of particles when a substance undergoes a phase change, specifically from a solid to a gas. What generally happens to the number of configurations the particles can have?

title: Entropy and Solid to Gas Transitions
text: When a solid like dry ice sublimates into a gas, consider how the movement and distribution of molecules changes. Are they more or less constrained than in the solid form?

title: Nature of Molecular Motion in Sublimation
text: In a solid, molecules are tightly packed and have very limited movement. In contrast, gas molecules are free to move and spread out widely. What implication does this have for entropy, which is a measure of disorder or randomness in the system?

title: Applying the Concept to Dry Ice Sublimation
text: Given that moving from solid to gas increases molecular freedom and randomness, predict the sign of the change in entropy when dry ice sublimates into carbon dioxide gas.
